alert.note: Alert for Marin; Napa; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 2:52AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rain has been occurring since last night across North Bay. There have been reports of localized roadway flooding from law enforcement and additional rain through the morning hours will continue minor flooding in urban areas, roadways, and small streams. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding from moderate to heavy rainfall has already occurred and is expected to continue through the morning, then diminish in the early afternoon. * WHERE...The heaviest rain has been falling across Sonoma and Marin counties along the coast and over higher terrain with moderate rain totals over Napa. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 238 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding has already occurred in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in continued minor flooding for low-lying areas and roadways. Morning commuters should be cautious. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Rosa, Napa, Petaluma, San Rafael, Novato, Rohnert Park, Windsor, American Canyon, Mill Valley, San Anselmo, Larkspur, Healdsburg, Sonoma, Corte Madera, Tiburon, Cloverdale, Fairfax, Sebastopol, Cotati and St. Helena. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Slow down when you see ponding of water on roadways.
